item.title: フリーダム・オブ・ザ・プレス財団、米国における秘密保護基盤改革に特化した役職「Daniel Ellsberg Chair on Government Secrecy」を発表 (Trevor Timm/Freedom of the Press ...)
item.description:
Trevor Timm / Freedom of the Press Foundation:
Freedom of the Press Foundation announces the Daniel Ellsberg Chair on Government Secrecy, a position dedicated to secrecy infrastructure reforms in the US  —  In one of his last public talks, to a room full of more than 200 journalists, Daniel Ellsberg was asked what the media could do to better support whistleblowers.

item.title: ピッチフォークEICのプジャ・パテルに、AIが音楽のあらゆる側面に浸透していること、AIが生成する音楽の所有権や金銭面での懸念などについてインタビュー（Wired）。
item.description:
Wired:
An interview with Pitchfork EIC Puja Patel on how AI is infiltrating every single aspect of music, AI-generated music's ownership and money concerns, and more  —  We talk to Puja Patel, editor in chief of Pitchfork and cohost of The Pitchfork Review, about how AI is taking over our feeds and where it goes from here.

item.title: 1,350社のパブリッシャーのChartbeatデータ：Twitterの紹介トラフィックは2018年4月の1.9%から2023年4月には1.2%に減少、中堅パブリッシャーのトラフィックは40%減少（Aisha Majid/Press Gazette)
item.description:
Aisha Majid / Press Gazette:
Chartbeat data for 1,350 publishers: Twitter referral traffic fell from 1.9% in April 2018 to 1.2% in April 2023; medium-sized publishers' traffic dropped 40%  —  Twitter - already a small source of clicks for publishers - has further declined in importance as a traffic referrer in recent years.

item.title: ライオンズゲート、第4四半期の売上高は前年同期比17％増の$1.1B（予想$974.9M）、純損失$96.8Mと予想を上回る、映画作品の売上高は前年同期比85％増の$532.1M (Scott Mendelson/The Wrap)。
item.description:
Scott Mendelson / The Wrap:
Lionsgate beats Q4 estimates with revenue up 17% YoY to $1.1B vs. $974.9M estimated, and a net loss of $96.8M; Motion Picture revenue rose 85% YoY to $532.1M  —  The Santa Monica-based mini-major again blasted past Wall Street predictions  —  Lionsgate again came in above market expectations …

item.title: Paramount Globalの親会社であるNational Amusementsが、家族経営企業の支援を専門とするBDT & MSD Partnersから$125Mの投資を受ける（Cynthia Littleton/Variety)
item.description:
Cynthia Littleton / Variety:
National Amusements, parent of Paramount Global, gets a $125M investment from BDT & MSD Partners, which specializes in supporting family-controlled businesses  —  Influx aims to take pressure off Paramount Global shares and possibly ease path to future transactioin

item.title: The Hillの元オーナーで、The Messengerを立ち上げたばかりのJimmy Finkelsteinに、サイトのビジネスモデル、拡大計画、批評家などについてインタビュー（Joe Pompeo/Vanity Fair）。
item.description:
Joe Pompeo / Vanity Fair:
An interview with Jimmy Finkelstein, former owner of The Hill who just launched The Messenger, on the site's business model, expansion plans, critics, and more  —  In a wide-ranging sit-down, the former Hill owner opens up to Vanity Fair about what's to come for his week-plus-old news site …

item.title: CNNがダウンタウンのCNNセンターからミッドタウンにある元の小さなテックウッドキャンパスに移転する準備の中で、アトランタにどのように貢献し、利益を得たか（Emma Hurt/Axios)
item.description:
Emma Hurt / Axios:
How CNN helped and benefited from Atlanta, as the company prepares to move out from downtown's CNN Center into its original, smaller Techwood campus in Midtown  —  Cable News Network — CNN — was founded in Atlanta in 1980 by media mogul Ted Turner as the world's first 24-hour television news network.

item.title: Twitch、顔文字やチャットバッジなどを追加提供する広告なしサブスクリプション「Turbo」を値上げ、米国価格は月額8.99ドルから11.99ドルに跳ね上がる（Jay Peters/The Verge）
item.description:
Jay Peters / The Verge:
Twitch raises the price of Turbo, its ad-free subscription that offers extra emoticons, chat badges, and more; the US price jumps from $8.99 to $11.99 per month  —  Twitch is raising the monthly price of Twitch Turbo, its monthly subscription that lets you pay to remove most ads …

item.title: DirecTV、NFLの試合をCMスポットに配信するために設立されたEverPass Mediaと、NFL Sunday Ticketの放送継続のための非独占的複数年契約を締結（Alex Sherman/CNBC)
item.description:
Alex Sherman / CNBC:
DirecTV strikes a nonexclusive multiyear deal with EverPass Media, formed to distribute NFL games to commercial spots, to keep broadcasting NFL Sunday Ticket  —  - DirecTV has struck a multiyear deal with EverPass Media to commercially provide the NFL's “Sunday Ticket” package.

item.title: ブラックカルチャーを中心とした広告付き無料ストリーミングサービス「Mansa」、AMC Theatresと提携し、米国の劇場でオリジナル長編・シリーズを展示（Dade Hayes/Deadline）
item.description:
Dade Hayes / Deadline:
Mansa, a free, ad-supported streaming service centered on Black culture, partners with AMC Theatres to exhibit its original features and series in US theaters  —  Mansa, a free, ad-supported streaming service centered on Black culture, has struck a distribution deal with AMC Theatres …

item.title: Google DeepMind、視覚言語モデル「Flamingo」がYouTube Shortsの説明文を生成し、メタデータとして保存、発見性の向上に貢献する方法を詳述（Jay Peters/The Verge）。
item.description:
Jay Peters / The Verge:
Google DeepMind details how its visual language model Flamingo generates descriptions for YouTube Shorts, stored as metadata and helping improve discoverability  —  Google just combined DeepMind and Google Brain into one big AI team, and on Wednesday, the new Google DeepMind shared details …

item.title: メモCNN、CNN en Españolの制作をメキシコシティにシフト、リニアTVの仕事を縮小しモバイルビデオを拡大；ソースはこちら：アトランタとマイアミは人員削減の可能性あり（Brian Steinberg/Variety)
item.description:
Brian Steinberg / Variety:
Memo: CNN shifts CNN en Español's production to Mexico City, scaling back linear TV work and expanding mobile video; source: Atlanta and Miami may see job cuts  —  CNN will shift the bulk of its operations behind its Spanish-language efforts to Mexico City, scaling back production …

item.title: YouTubeは2023年6月26日にストーリーズを閉鎖し、Shorts、Community投稿、ライブ動画、通常のコンテンツなど、他の主要分野に注力する予定（Sarah Perez/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Sarah Perez / TechCrunch:
YouTube plans to shut down Stories on June 26, 2023, as the company focuses on other key areas, like Shorts, Community posts, live videos, and its usual content  —  Stories are over — at least on YouTube, that is.  The Google-owned video site announced today that YouTube Stories will be shutting …

item.title: MoviePassが米国で再始動、クレジット制の4段階、1～3本で月10ドルから、映画のクレジットでの「コスト」は上映時間によって異なる（Brian Heater/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Brian Heater / TechCrunch:
MoviePass relaunches in the US with four credit-based tiers, starting at $10/month for one to three movies; a film's “cost” in credits depends on the showtime  —  As promised, MoviePass is returning.  After last year's Labor Day beta/waiting list launch, the movie theater subscription service …

item.title: メールWall Street JournalのEIC、Emma Tuckerによると、副EICのNeal LipschutzとJason Andersが新聞社を去り、Lipschutzは41年ぶりに引退するとのこと（Chris Roush/Talking Biz News）。
item.description:
Chris Roush / Talking Biz News:
Email: Wall Street Journal EIC Emma Tucker says Deputy EICs Neal Lipschutz and Jason Anders are leaving the newspaper; Lipschutz is retiring after 41 years  —  Wall Street Journal editor in chief Emma Tucker sent out the following on Thursday:  —  Dear All,
